metadata.name: Qajar Revolt
metadata.description:
Qajar paintings are a unique art form that emerged during the Qajar dynasty in Iran (1789-1925). These paintings often depict the rulers and elite members of society, and are known for their intricate details, rich colors, and striking compositions. One of the most striking aspects of these paintings is the way they depict women, who are often shown in a traditional and passive role.

By using AI to generate images inspired by these Qajar paintings, we can challenge these traditional representations of women and imagine them in new and powerful roles. AI art has the potential to open up new possibilities for artistic expression and experimentation, allowing us to explore new perspectives and ideas. In this case, using AI to reimagine Persian women as heroes in the style of Qajar paintings is a way to pay homage to the past while also creating something new and meaningful.  
a part of our income from the Qajar Revolt collection will go towards buying VPN accounts for Iran to help the people bypass the severe internet filtrations in the country.
